name: Ghee Roast Dosa
history: Ghee Roast Dosa is a popular South Indian dish known for its rich aroma and flavor, imparted by ghee (clarified butter). It's a favorite in many Indian households and restaurants.
description: Ghee Roast Dosa is a thin, crisp dosa cooked with ghee, giving it a distinct flavor and golden color. It's typically enjoyed with chutney and sambar.

equipment.name: spatula
equipment.description: For spreading and flipping the dosas.

instructions.title: Prepare Dosa Batter
instructions.description: Soak the parboiled rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds in water for at least 6 hours or overnight. Drain and grind them into a smooth batter using a blender or grinder, adding water as needed. The consistency should be slightly thick. Transfer the batter to a large mixing bowl, cover, and let it ferment in a warm place for 8-10 hours or until it doubles in size.

instructions.title: Making Ghee Roast Dosa
instructions.description: Heat a griddle or tawa over medium heat. Once hot, pour a ladleful of the fermented batter onto the center of the griddle. Using the back of the ladle, spread the batter in a circular motion to form a thin crepe. Drizzle ghee over the dosa and around its edges.

instructions.title: Cook the Dosa
instructions.description: Cook the dosa until it turns golden brown and crisp. The ghee will give the dosa a rich flavor and aroma. Flip the dosa and cook for another minute on the other side.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Fold the dosa and serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar. Repeat the process with the remaining batter to make more dosas.

tips: Maintain a medium heat to ensure the dosa cooks evenly without burning.
Use a non-stick tawa or well-seasoned iron griddle for the best results.
variations: For a masala dosa variation, fill the dosa with potato masala before folding.
Add finely chopped onions or grated cheese on top of the dosa for different flavors.

storage.shelfLife: Batter can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store the batter in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Reheat the dosa on a hot griddle for a few minutes until warm and crispy.

presentationTips: Serve on a banana leaf for an authentic touch.
Garnish with a sprig of curry leaves or coriander.
